channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: EPro-PnP: Generalized End-to-End Probabilistic Perspective-n-Points for Monocular Object Pose Estimation
item.description: The 2D-3D coordinates and corresponding weights are treated as intermediate variables learned by minimizing the KL divergence between the predicted and target pose distribution.

item.title: Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code
item.description: We introduce Codex, a GPT language model fine-tuned on publicly available code from GitHub, and study its Python code-writing capabilities.

item.title: Pythae: Unifying Generative Autoencoders in Python -- A Benchmarking Use Case
item.description: In recent years, deep generative models have attracted increasing interest due to their capacity to model complex distributions.

item.title: Nocturne: a scalable driving benchmark for bringing multi-agent learning one step closer to the real world
item.description: We introduce \textit{Nocturne}, a new 2D driving simulator for investigating multi-agent coordination under partial observability.

item.title: MineDojo: Building Open-Ended Embodied Agents with Internet-Scale Knowledge
item.description: Autonomous agents have made great strides in specialist domains like Atari games and Go.

item.title: Zero-Shot Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Text-to-image generation has traditionally focused on finding better modeling assumptions for training on a fixed dataset.

item.title: Free-Form Image Inpainting with Gated Convolution
item.description: We present a generative image inpainting system to complete images with free-form mask and guidance.

item.title: The ArtBench Dataset: Benchmarking Generative Models with Artworks
item.description: We introduce ArtBench-10, the first class-balanced, high-quality, cleanly annotated, and standardized dataset for benchmarking artwork generation.

item.title: HaGRID -- HAnd Gesture Recognition Image Dataset
item.description: In this paper, we introduce an enormous dataset HaGRID (HAnd Gesture Recognition Image Dataset) for hand gesture recognition (HGR) systems.

item.title: EdgeNeXt: Efficiently Amalgamated CNN-Transformer Architecture for Mobile Vision Applications
item.description: Our EdgeNeXt model with 1. 3M parameters achieves 71. 2\% top-1 accuracy on ImageNet-1K, outperforming MobileViT with an absolute gain of 2. 2\% with 28\% reduction in FLOPs.

item.title: Scaling Autoregressive Models for Content-Rich Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: We present the Pathways Autoregressive Text-to-Image (Parti) model, which generates high-fidelity photorealistic images and supports content-rich synthesis involving complex compositions and world knowledge.

item.title: OmniXAI: A Library for Explainable AI
item.description: We introduce OmniXAI (short for Omni eXplainable AI), an open-source Python library of eXplainable AI (XAI), which offers omni-way explainable AI capabilities and various interpretable machine learning techniques to address the pain points of understanding and interpreting the decisions made by machine learning (ML) in practice.

item.title: Multiplying Matrices Without Multiplying
item.description: Multiplying matrices is among the most fundamental and compute-intensive operations in machine learning.

item.title: RegionCLIP: Region-based Language-Image Pretraining
item.description: However, we show that directly applying such models to recognize image regions for object detection leads to poor performance due to a domain shift: CLIP was trained to match an image as a whole to a text description, without capturing the fine-grained alignment between image regions and text spans.

item.title: Voxel-MAE: Masked Autoencoders for Pre-training Large-scale Point Clouds
item.description: As the point clouds in 3D object detection is large-scale, it is impossible to reconstruct the input point clouds.

item.title: Polar Parametrization for Vision-based Surround-View 3D Detection
item.description: Based on Polar Parametrization, we propose a surround-view 3D DEtection TRansformer, named PolarDETR.

item.title: How Well Do Sparse Imagenet Models Transfer?
item.description: Transfer learning is a classic paradigm by which models pretrained on large "upstream" datasets are adapted to yield good results on "downstream" specialized datasets.

item.title: reStructured Pre-training
item.description: In addition, we test our model in the 2022 College Entrance Examination English that happened a few days ago (2022. 06. 08), and it gets a total score of 134 (v. s.

item.title: Learning to Solve Hard Minimal Problems
item.description: The hard minimal problems arise from relaxing the original geometric optimization problem into a minimal problem with many spurious solutions.

item.title: EnvPool: A Highly Parallel Reinforcement Learning Environment Execution Engine
item.description: On a high-end machine, EnvPool achieves 1 million frames per second for the environment execution on Atari environments and 3 million frames per second on MuJoCo environments.
